meanings.sent1: The dancers twirled in graceful cirls on the stage.
meanings.sent2: The carousel spun around in colorful cirls at the fair.
meanings.sent3: The puppy chased its tail in playful cirls around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The wind created swirling cirls of leaves in the park.
meanings.sent5: Her drawing depicted intricate cirls and loops.

meanings.definition: To move in a circular motion.
meanings.sent1: The skater likes to cirl around the rink effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The plane will cirl in the sky before landing.
meanings.sent3: The children love to cirl around the maypole during festivals.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts cirl in my mind like a whirlpool.
meanings.sent5: The ballerina will cirl gracefully on her toes.

meanings.definition: A small, circular mark or shape.
meanings.sent1: She noticed tiny cirls of dust on the old bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: The artist added delicate cirls to the painting for detail.
meanings.sent3: The cat left muddy cirls on the clean floor after playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The moon cast a soft cirl of light through the window.
meanings.sent5: The ring had intricate cirls engraved on its surface.
